hackathon-judges.judge-role: Assistant Professor of Computer Science at Bryn Mawr College
Visiting Assistant Professor of Computer Science at Swarthmore College

hackathon-eligibility: To participate in SisterHacks you must be a student at a Seven Sisters college (Barnard, Bryn Mawr, Mount Holyoke, Smith, Vassar, and Wellesley Colleges).
hackathon-requirements: Please submit all materials associated with the project. This may include links to github repositories, online projects, and presentations.
hackathon-rules: All projects submitted for judging must be created at SisterHacks, and not prior to the event.
hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=203 N Merion Ave, Bryn Mawr, PA 19010, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Does the project work correctly? Does it make use of appropriate technology? How difficult was the problem chosen?
Does the project address a problem? Does it provide a clear solution? Could it be further developed after the hackathon?
Does the project demonstrate an interesting or imaginative idea?
How well does the project make use of its technology? Does it work from start to finish?
Is the design user-friendly? It is clear and easy to use? Is the workflow intuitive?

hackathon-location-address: 203 N Merion Ave, Bryn Mawr, PA 19010, USA
hackathon-description-header: The first hackathon for the Seven Sisters schools.
